reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

description.narrative: PAUKWA CHILDREN ART FESTIVAL is an annual event for children aiming at bringing them together and share experiences on various forms of art through the expression of their own ideas.. Paukwa has managed to bring together seventy five schools reaching an av erage of 45 000 children for the past four yearsObjectives of Paukwa Children Art Festival is to enable the children to be creative express their imaginations and develop their talents. This way develop a Nation of positive minds thinkers and hard workers. This year's Festival is scheduled for June 16th - 18th 2015 at Morogoro Municipality whereby twenty Primary Schools will take part in the festival. The event will be working on various form of art such as Music Traditional dance Modern dance storytelling Drama Poetry recitations Fashion and designs Painting + handcrafts Singing+ Children monologs. All presentations will depend on what each particular school choose to represent.The expected impact include: support creative thinking through art this will hel p to build a Nation of peace lovers and volunteers also significantly contribute to the development of art and culture in the country, teach children to appreciate and value life, support learning of various subjects through art, creating passion and respe ct to art as a profession, create fun and enjoyment to the children, create friendship among children, support the Nation's peace and stability from the grass root
